meaningMnemonic:
The <kanji>whole</kanji> <kanji>reason</kanji> our country is still running is because of our "minister" (大臣). Which minister? The <vocabulary>prime minister</vocabulary>, of course. Without our prime minister, we'd all be doomed I say. DOOMED!

Unlike 首相, which can be used for any prime minister, this word is used only for the <vocabulary>Japanese prime minister</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own. It's also a combination of two words you've learned before, 総理 and 大臣.
